labels.analysis: The MCP Server "paperpal" is designed to assist with literature reviews, particularly in the field of machine learning. It provides tools to search for academic papers on HuggingFace and arXiv, facilitating research discovery and discussion. The core functionality revolves around searching, retrieving, and organizing research papers to enhance writing and idea organization.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" is chosen because the server's main functionality is about searching and retrieving academic papers, which aligns with research activities. "Web Search" is also relevant as it accesses online repositories (arXiv and HuggingFace). The custom label "Academic Research Assistant" is added to highlight its specialized role in supporting literature reviews in the machine learning field.

tools.name: semantic_search_papers_on_huggingface
tools.description:
Search for papers on HuggingFace using semantic search.

    Args:
        query (str): The query term to search for. It will automatically determine if it should use keywords or a natural language query, so format your queries accordingly.
        top_n (int): The number of papers to return. Default is 10, but you can set it to any number.

    Returns:
        str: A list of papers with the title, summary, ID, and upvotes.

tools.name: fetch_paper_details_from_arxiv
tools.description:
Get the Arxiv info for a list of papers.

    Args:
        arxiv_ids (list[str] | str): The IDs of the papers to get the Arxiv info for, e.g. ["2503.01469", "2503.01470"]

server_info_crawled.name: paperpal
server_info_crawled.author: @jerpint/paperpal
server_info_crawled.overview: Enhance your literature review process by seamlessly searching and discussing machine learning papers. Engage in natural conversations with your LLMs to discover new research and organize your ideas effectively. Leverage the power of arXiv and Hugging Face papers to enrich your writing experience.

tools.name: semantic_search_papers_on_huggingface
tools.description:
Search for papers on HuggingFace using semantic search.

    Args:
        query (str): The query term to search for. It will automatically determine if it should use keywords or a natural language query, so format your queries accordingly.
        top_n (int): The number of papers to return. Default is 10, but you can set it to any number.

    Returns:
        str: A list of papers with the title, summary, ID, and upvotes.

tools.name: fetch_paper_details_from_arxiv
tools.description:
Get the Arxiv info for a list of papers.

    Args:
        arxiv_ids (list[str] | str): The IDs of the papers to get the Arxiv info for, e.g. ["2503.01469", "2503.01470"]

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@jerpint/paperpal/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
